website_summaries.verdict: Slightly older shoe design, but comfortable fit. Trusted brand name among hiking shoe makers.
pros: Rubber sole includes a sturdy grip for soft ground consisting of mud and snow
Extra rubber around the toe box for protection
More than a dozen bright color combinations
cons: Rubber tread may not last under heavy use
Will feel sharp rocks through sole

customer_reviews.title: Too small.... too skinny... sad to return them
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I had to return these. They are made for extremely slim feet. I've never seen such a slim shoe. My feet aren't particularly wide either. I don't wear any extra-wide shoes nor is it necessary. My feet bulged over the sides of the shoe and it felt like walking in them would have been agony let alone hiking in them. Promptly returning these. Aesthetically they're beautiful shoes, they seem well-made, but they just won't work for me. I got 11.5 and My toe runs right up to the end of them. My Asic Kayano 19's I've had 4 years are 11.5 and fit just right. I'll be getting Asic Gel Venture 5's in the mail shortly.
customer_reviews.author: pfictionfan4life

customer_reviews.title: Great trail runners, but can slip on wet surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I have put about 15 miles of hiking on them so far, almost entirely in the sand and gravel. The cleats really grab terrain, but slid a bit on wet cement at the beach. I was shocked the first time I doffed them to find that no sand had weaseled its way inside the shoes. They breath, but don't let in debris. I was skeptical of the lock laces when I first put them on. They are a lot different than the other ones I have used, but they do work well and do not seem to loosen through use. These are my first pair of Solomon shoes, and I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Eizu

customer_reviews.title: They run a little tight
customer_reviews.text: They run a half size too small and are a tad tight on the sides. Most brands like Nike, Puma, Ecco, Jordan’s, and Reebok fit with an 8. If I were to purchase these again, I would have to try a 8.5 maybe an 8.5 E, to see if it is a perfect fit. I’ve used them anyways for two years after stretching them out and wearing the thinnest socks on the planet. Lol, not doing that again. They are super durable and have tons of grip.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: JUST OK
customer_reviews.text: I'm definitely let down by the FEEL of the shoe from a straight comfort standpoint. It would be a lower score if the shoes didn't do what everyone else said they would do, and that's provide great traction on trails. Yes they do!! They are snug. And they have suddenly started a couple of "hot spots" on the top of toes after two weeks of use. HOW IS THAT? Next time I think I will go one a half size larger. They ARE very lightweight. I DO appreciate that. But they simply are not made for "comfort" if you will. Then again....what's "comfortable" about trail running? My point is--my feet shouldn't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN H. TURNER

customer_reviews.title: Tough mudder became Easy Mudder.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were amazing during my tough mudder run. While so many people were slipping and sliding down the steep hills, I casually walked right by them. The traction is unbelieveble, the fit was spot on, the weight was light, and the laces made tying my shoe a breeze. I cannot wait to try these shoes for the camp Pendleton run. If you buy anything for a mud run, these shoes are your best bet. I cannot stress enough how great these shoes are. If you are a weekend warrior, you need these shoes in your bag for every run.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Injury risk
customer_reviews.text: I injured myself running on pavement with these shoes but its mostly because I live in the city so I didn't get the full trail or dirt experience of which I think is intended for. I absolutely love the design and tight fit however its hard to get over the hard landing (baseball cleat like) when your running on sidewalks or pavement. In all I can't give it it fair review being that I did not test them on trails or dirt however I still feel the need to warn others about the injury risks associated with running on pavement or hard floors in general
customer_reviews.author: Weskers

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and great traction
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of these and I still love them. These are so comfortable for hiking/biking/trail running that I could almost run on a track with them. Super light even though the tread would make you think otherwise. I also love the lace garage feature in the tongue of the shoe, its pretty genius and all shoes should have them. I'm pretty active outside and will say that they only lasted about a year and a half but for $90 I don't expect much longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyJ

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight, supportive, and durable!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these shoes, wore them for hiking, definitely stood up to the test of a 14 mile hike. Anytime I jammed my toe, didn't feel a thing, super comfortable, after I washed them, didn't show a single bit of wear/tear. Quick lacing system is a god send, so easy, and so fast. My feet did start to feel a little sore around mile 10, and I could start to feel every rock, etc. probably just need to upgrade the insole. The grip was great as well. No problems with blisters/heat, even though I was hiking in TX in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great for clinical medicine!
customer_reviews.text: These are now trending at hospitals and clinical medicine. I know a few people buy them after they saw mine. I have three pairs - super light weight and comfortable. I would recommend these even for indoors use in addition to trails. Aggressive design, great colors along with comfort make these a winner. The are not soft like a Nike product and offer a more solid support. Speed lace design eliminates the need for shoes coming untied or getting caught. They seem to wear well so far. Also, yes, the green men's match green scrubs!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, inexpensive and outstanding grip on all surfaces!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are correct. These shoes are great. They have outstanding traction and comfort. Completely not what I was expecting for this price and type of shoe. Ran a 5 mi Spartan race without breaking them in they did not leave my feet sore or blistered. They did great in water and down steep loose dirt hills. I was flying past my buddies who were slipping all over the place. The lace lock was great too. Did not loosen one bit. Would definitely recommend. As to be expected, I would NOT recommend wearing them on pavement for any length of time as it would wear down the plastic spikes prematurely. These shoes are not meant for asphalt or concrete.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Performed Admirably During OCRs
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of Trail/OCR shoes ever. Great quality of construction and very comfortable. I've been a long time owner of other iterations of Salomon running shoes which have all performed well. These were actually the first Trail/OCR shoes I've ever purchased from Salomon and they continue the tradition of the company's awesomeness. I was never concerned about the durability of their construction and the speed lacing system is a nice touch. These shoes kicked ass on OCRs. The grip and stability afforded by the tread in both mud and dryer rocky/uneven terrain is phenomenal. On a side note, I think they are aesthetically appealing and simply look badass.
customer_reviews.author: Spirit_Matrix

customer_reviews.title: Have you ever worn a condom ?
customer_reviews.text: Analogy: They're like wearing a condom ! Light weight, snug and ya don't even know they're on :) Top quality obviously, they're Salomon. They are as advertised; a top notch trail shoe that I even wear casually...they're that comfortable. However, if your feet are even slightly beyond average width they could be somewhat tight (not sure if they come in a wide). My feet are just slightly narrow, so, these are perfect for me. The length seems to be true to size, or just a hair on the small size. I wear a 10 or 10.5 depending on the manufacturer, I got a 10.5
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. I have high arch and I pronate so I need a shoe with lot more cushioning and support. I tried Innov-8 tellon, Merrell all-out crush and Salomons. I prefer Salomon even though they are heavier than other shoes. It will depend on your feet and how you run. I ran with them during Battlefrog and didn't feel any pain in my heels or knees. That's a big change for me as my knees or heels start paining after 3-4 miles run or hike. The only thing I don't like is that once the water/mud goes inside the shoes become even heavier. Also, I would prefer the regular laces instead of the lace system Salomons have.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Traction of a Mountain Goat
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about these shoes. They fit as expected, are incredibly lightweight and are really comfortable. When trail running or hiking on steep, loose terrain having confidence in your footing is key. Worry not with these. The Speedcross 3 & 4's provide you with the grippy performance of a veteran mountain goat. They are like cleats for the trail! I have not slipped nor fallen once due to poor traction with these strapped to my feet. The only drawback of all that grippy goodness is the sole is made of soft rubber that wears out fairly quickly on rocky terrain. But whatever, I'd rather have that than falling on my butt or slipping and getting injured.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brosky

customer_reviews.title: Great built shoe for Obstacle Racing and trail running
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for many Spartan and Tough Mudder races and they worked really well. The bottom sole was slightly ripping but it didn't effect the durability. The water drainage was perfect and quicklace a huge plus. Pair these shoes with Vermont Darn tough toe socks and you are in business.
customer_reviews.author: William C.

customer_reviews.title: I like this model better for the fact that it has ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this model better for the fact that it has the Quick-lace system. The Sonic Aero (of which I also bought) has the regular lacing system as most shoes... If you lace it up using all holes, it gives a great snug fit at the ankle, but it's a pain in the ass IMO to take of the shoes LOL... comfortable as an everyday/all day shoe for me at work though. I guess it's because I've worn Salomon's Speedcross 3 for several years (8 pairs so far) with the Quick-lace system - it's fast and easy to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: INTEL

customer_reviews.title: Lack of any thickness or cushioning in the sole makes these unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Fit and build quality is OK. 1 star for the ultra thin cushioning on the bottom. Only use I can see for these is soft forest or mud with no rocks or hard objects. I've tried them on a few trails and even a small amount of rocks or hard objects will start bruising your feed after 5+ miles. I have extremely tough feet as I do a lot of walking barefoot, but for going faster these are horrible. I've primarily switched tofor trail running and absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Strong support in the heel and ankle
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Strong support in the heel and ankle, but without being too stiff. The steep heel-toe drop was great for my knee, which has been suffering from tendonitis for 3 months. Haven't been able to run more than 2 miles without pain, but I put these bad boys on and ran 5 miles no problem. Then, later that same day, I ran 5 more! The lacing system is convenient and stays in place even in rugged terrain. Sole is thick enough to protect your feet, but not so thick that you can't feel the rocks and roots you're landing on. Definitely gonna buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H.

customer_reviews.title: Great trail running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great trail running shoes. DO NOT USE ON CONCRETE, ASPHALT, OR THE TRACK. If you do, you will wear out the special treads for the trail. Okay if you have the run on non-trail for a very short brief period. I got these for Tough Mudder and other Mud runs, and they were perfect for me. I got the Salomon Gaiters as well. Great combo. If you do not want to spend money and return and return to find your size, i would recommend going to a REI and finding out your size and buying here for much less. These shoes are True to size, if you wear dress shoes size 11, Salomon size 11 will fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: L I T O

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and excellent support!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Salomon summer hikers, a pair of winter boots and I have owned Salomon skis and Boots forever. My 2nd pair of running shoes and I am very happy and satisfied with my purchase. Great fit and feel like a glove. Great support for me at 5'11" , 185lbs. Trails and street. Easy on, easy off with quick zip lacing. I plan to stick with Salomon for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: T.P.

customer_reviews.title: strange feelings about this shoe
customer_reviews.text: too narrow. If you have wide feet, this is not the shoe you want. It doesn't get better over time either. you can't wear them on a daily basis. I have been trying for more than a month. If you walk all day with these shoes, my feet hurt, especially the back part of the show. I still wear them daily, trying not to use them on days that I have to stay on foot for a long time, which is why I originally bought them for. Strangely though the shoe covers your feet really well, your feet feels safe for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ilan

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Spartan race
customer_reviews.text: Just finish the Tristate Sparta at Mountain Creek 10/22. The weather was horrible. The shoes were just the perfect shoes for the conditions. We had rain, mud, rocky, just the worst conditions. I saw a lot of people loosing grip. I did not experience once slipped during the race. Did I mention how brutal this super was? The shoes fit just right. If you have a wide foot this might be a problem. The shoes does not have any wiggle room and snuggles your foot all around. This make the shoe feel solid and you foot feel secure as you land. The picture after the race and after washing them. Aroo! Aroo! Aroo!!!
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: This is my second pair of Speedcross;
customer_reviews.text: I love the aggressive tread design, and the quickdraw laces are fast & durable. I had an older pair that I trained for and ran a trail marathon with. The old pair finally started coming apart after literally hundreds of miles. This pair seems to be slightly thinner material, and after only 7 months of just walking in them, they are starting show signs that the stitches may come apart soon, have some fraying. I hope Salomon goes back to the thicker material.
customer_reviews.author: clint barnett

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These have been great so far. The look good and fit perfectly. I was concerned about the lacing system when I bought the shoes, but have had no problems at all and the lacing hasn't affected the fit at all. I've had a great experience and I'd buy Salomon again. 05/22/16 2 years later and I still love these shoes. I've done everything in them and the traction is almost completely flat now. I still wear them daily and was so pleased with them that I'm the proud owner of four other pairs of Salomon shoes for various activities (snow boots, running shoes, etc). 12/02/17 Still using these, though, now they're relegated to yard work. Best shoes on the market.
customer_reviews.author: BishopsGate

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy trail shoe traction
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe in mud, snow, and loose soil. Not good on hard packed trails or rocky surfaces. The cushioning was not responsive enough to keep my legs from feeling the miles. These kicks have great traction, easy cinch cord, & very well built upper, but lower too stiff for the trails I run on. Less offset (12mm) and a little more cushion would make these kicks much better.
customer_reviews.author: Regular human

customer_reviews.title: Like a mean, rugged glove for your feet.
customer_reviews.text: Wicked shoes. I only wear them trail running or on the shooting range, but these grip terrain like nobodies business. A friend wears them all day, but he also gets new ones about every 6 months as the rubber tread is not made for concrete. They do fit snug on every inch of the foot which is good and bad since our feet don't often measure out exactly a shoe size. So, be SURE of your size. The fastening system is weird, and time will tell how long it lasts, but they do sell relacing kits should your shoe outlast the lace.
customer_reviews.author: AustinTexas

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for me
customer_reviews.text: Super grippy which is great, but I would not say these are wide. They are for the most part narrow. I have very wide feet though. I do like the pull tab rather than the laces for easy on and off. I used in two 50 mile runs now and they felt good for how much a 50 mile run will feel. Used in lots of sand and had no issues with sand getting in the shoe. I think these might be better fast hiking shoes rather than running just cause of my own personal issues with the width. So I like them, but they are nothing great.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Salomon  Speedcross 3
customer_reviews.text: Just got them and tried on. First impression is good. Fit is as expected. The quality of the shoe is top notch. Sides feel stiff coming up around sole to foot but once on they feel good. They look very narrow from above when wearing even tho fitment is good. Treads are massive. I was wondering if the quick lace just hung out or if they had a place to tuck and they do. They tuck into the tongue of the shoe which is nice. Once I've had them for awhile and actually run in them, I'll post a more thorough review.
customer_reviews.author: IdahoTater

customer_reviews.title: Good for forest walking.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in between sizes and chose the smaller size and it was to small, so go up a 1/2 size if your in between like me. Also a "little" narrow but not as narrow as Italian shoes I have bought. I use these for mushroom hunting and walk on wet hills a lot and these have great traction. I have not slipped once when walking through the forest or climbing over logs etc... For the most part they are comfortable once i got the right size. I must prefer shoes like this then boots for walking through the forest.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are great trail running shoes with aggressive tread. I bought them because of another reviewer saying he wore them on all surfaces and shoes lasted for a year. Obviously the tread wore down a little by then. I may have misread the description but I thought they were supposed to come with a spare set of speed quick lace. They did not. No worries as they look well made. I like the stowage pocket on the tongue. Looks great with jeans as well. Liked so much I ordered two more.
customer_reviews.author: Army Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Traction and a good trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I have owned. I was so impressed with my first pair I purchased another. I used them for trail running and day hiking. The traction on these shoes is better than hiking boots. I have seen reviews where people have complained about wear and tear - if you walk on pavement/concrete - then any sports shoe will wear quickly. I have used these shoes in snow, ice, rain , mud and dry conditions in the white mountains trail running and they have been absolutely fantastic for me. The conditions here put everything to the test including me!!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Best Trail/Obstacle Race shoe ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. I run Spatan Beasts and Tough mudder races and only run on trails when I train. These take a licking and keep on kicking. They sinch laces are one of the best things about them. No untied shoe laces, or muddy shoe laces at all. The knobby tread is like a mountain bike tire and is probably the best i have seen on any shoe ever. If you are a trail runner or and obstacle race runner, these are the shoes for you
customer_reviews.author: SM2Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable great traction on most any terrain. My first weekend with them saw a verity of challenges. Wet ocean boulders a muddy dusty trail with trees down blocking the path. No matter what I had to step on I gained confidence that I wouldn't slip. A little painfull on the decent from the small toe box they have. They run a little small and narrow so read reviews and size carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great winter shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them in the recent cold and snow storm we got. They were warm and gave great traction in the snow and on the ice! I was very surprised at how warm they really are. Though they did allow some water in at least my feet stayed nice and warm. I highly recommend these for anyone running during the winter. I would order the wide size if you take a medium width like me just for a little extra room. They did loosen up. Just in case you want to wear an extra pair of socks. I use them in the cold Wisconsin winters so they will be great just about anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Favorite trail shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I trail run the McDowell mountains (Sonoran desert). Sharp rocks and cactus thorns on the trails. The shoes hold up very well. This is my fourth pair in 2 1/2 years. Generally get about 400-500 miles out of them. Ran Grand Canyon rim to river and hiked back out and my feet were never bothered. Can't say that about my legs though. I love the speed laces. Tuck away neatly. Also removable insoul. Wash the shoes quite regularly because of the amount of dust being in the desert. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe that's light weight. I LOVE the lack of laces..so quick and easy to tie and excellent for a germaphobe like me who occasionally finds shoelaces getting untied and soaking up restroom floor burn-your-shoes-goop. If you're planning on wearing these as your daily walk around shoes, be aware that they will not last very long. The soles are very very soft and will wear down quickly. Any other premature failure will be taken care of with their 2 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Beat trail running/OCR shoe on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the Speedcross 3's for a few years now, and I've yet to come across a better combination of comfort, durability, and grip. The lugs are very durable and wore down much slower than I expected, the uper is fairly breathable and can take a beating. I only wish that they expelled water a little better. When you run through heavy water, mud pits, etc. they remain squishy for a while. The shoe does fit a little snug, so if you have wider feet I would recommend going up a half size. Overall I recommend these to anyone serious about the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Harris

customer_reviews.title: great shoe but make it impossible to keep
customer_reviews.text: loved the shoe until a lace broke (1 wearing). bought replacement laces, which were hard to find, as only certain laces fit. took 1.5 hours to replace even with all the tricks. won't ever purchase salomon shoes again
customer_reviews.author: Paolo

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, only one drawback
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes, even with supportive insoles they are lighter than other sneakers/running shoes, and the tread is much more aggressive. The only deficiency I see in the design is the high heel- It's a huge liability if you twist your ankle, as could happen if you are running quickly through rugged terrain. If you're going to be doing that, I would suggest some of the mid-boot options by salomon. They won't be as light, but they will protect your ankles better when you inevitably slip.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: These Shoes Are Stable Beyond Explanation... Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Salomon Speedcross shoes are supportive and stable beyond explanation. They are as much more stable than regular running shoes as regular running shoes are more stable that casual and dress shoes. No joke! I am disabled by Chronic Vertigo, and have been since 2003. Yes, that's right... I've had Vertigo non-stop for over twelve years. I know a little something about stability and how to detect it. :-) I wear these for everything but lounging around. They are truly amazing stable shoes. When you need a little extra, they make these with ClimaShield. If you need even more than that... the Salomon FellCross are these on steroids... practically magic.
customer_reviews.author: S. Templar

customer_reviews.title: Had my Speedcross 3 since 2015 and love them. Had been solid Nike fan since the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had my Speedcross 3 since 2015 and love them. Had been solid Nike fan since the 90's and finally broke down and bought a pair of Solomons. These shoes are with every penny especially if you run on ragged trails with rocks, roots, etc. I run on trails around the Charlotte, NC area and these faired better than any of my Nike trail running shoes I've ever had. Don't recommend using these on pavement. I did for a week or two and it seemed to wear down the cleats pretty fast. Solomon makes a city trail shoe that is VERY good as well for running on pavement. Your feet, ankles and knees will thank you for these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: DIY Customer

customer_reviews.title: Obstacle course approved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for obstacle course racing and trail running and they were amazing! Comfortable, great support, didn't fall off or get stuck in the mud! Easy to clean and dry for future uses. I have wide feet and wear a women's size 10 in shoes and these required no breaking in, accommodated my wife feet with no aches or pains. Ran 15+miles total in them during my racing events with no issues at all! Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Ferrante

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are exceptionally comfortable running shoes. I purchased them for doing agility on wet grass field conditions and thus far, they are performing superbly. They are incredibly comfortable right out of the box - with no break-in period. I haven't had them for very long but they seem very well made. These shoes were recommended by my agility instructor and I can't thank her enough! I do recommend that you try these shoes on (preferably in a store) before purchasing them because I got a full size larger than my usual shoe size. They come in many different colors and the men's model colors are different than the women's model colors. Good job Salomon! I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great off-trail / rocky trail shoe! but...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent traction here in NorCal, clay, crushed basalt rocky trails mix. A little too thin/stiff in the sole, I feel every sharp edge or pebble-sized and up rock while going along. The Speedcross3 are SLIGHTLY small / narrow for my wide foot [mens 13] - I made the mistake of ordering from a supplier that does not have free returns/return shipping... BIG MISTAKE as I'm not sure these will make the cut based on my initial fitting. I have wide feet and generally Salomon shoes run roomy for me. I will try a sz14 next time (and through Zappos or Prime).
customer_reviews.author: Rod Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both got a pair of these. We immediately took them out to hike Mt. Pilchuck and Blanca Lake in Washington state. Quite intensive hikes. We absolutely loved these things. Mt Pilchuck is rocky, and a lady at REI told us these probably wouldn't provide traction on the rocks. Well, that was not our experience. They work wonderfully. My feet have never handled a hike so well as when I was wearing these. I could have doubled up on hikes if my quads and hams were in better shape. Even having not broken them in we had no problems. I would highly recommend these shoes to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: comfy, great traction, better than my cleats!
customer_reviews.text: super comfy, no break in time, excellent traction on grass. i lost my cleats, or misplaced them, same thing. getting ready to play on our ultimate frisbee league, i grabbed these instead since my girl got the lady version for hiking saw these on clearance and pulled the trigger these puppies were so good on the grass field, cutting corners, i never looked back my lady now wears hers for ultimate. these also make a great everyday schlebbing shoe we also took them hiking but i didn't feel they had enough support.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jun

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. If you're like me and upgrade from bad shoes to these then you're in for a real treat. They fit perfectly and give great ankle support. I use these primarily for trail/ mountain running and couldn't be happier. The only con I have is I couldn't figure out how to lace the stupid things. I had to watch a YouTube video demonstration, but once you get used to it they are great.
customer_reviews.author: C.R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Difficult to add Lace Locks
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are perfect, except that the leaves style are rigid rather than the bungee material of Lacelocks. Thus I cut the original laces off, and added bungee Lacelocks. The laces wouldn't thread, so I found the easiest solution is to use a shish kabob skewer, and lead the laces through. They can't be taped because there isn't enough room for the tape. You just have to push the skewer through with the laces.
customer_reviews.author: @RandomReality

customer_reviews.title: Great for Trail and Field. Not for Spartan Racing
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. Easy on and off. Comfortable padding, which also makes not the best for total water submersion (like in Spartan races) because padding inside will stay squishy till you dry them out. Not good for rope climbing because top and side of shoe is slippery (good for water repellent like on a wet trail or field) . Not good for wall scaling because side-bottom of shoe hasn't any shelf (rounded on sides, would need to be more squared). Trail and field running are great. Also great for all day wear.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R. Curtner

customer_reviews.title: Just buy these
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for about two years now and they are the best pair I've ever owned. I threw some inserts into them for additional support, and I actually use them as shoes I wear with gym shorts for every day use / gym use. I also ran the Spartan Sprint in these and cleaned them in the washing machine, and I've since worn them for kick boxing at the gym. They've been through the wash probably 4-5 times and I've put some serious miles on them and they are still in peak condition. I would buy another pair if this first pair ever manages to wear out! Seriously, these are highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Tied for the best.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit, the support, the comfort, the weight, the durability, and for the most part, the tread. Aside from the tread, these beat out my Saucony Perigrin 5s. I find the on the scree riddled trails in southern Arizona, that the Speedcross tread is not aggressive enough, and over any wet terrain, I need to slow down or risk losing my footing. In summary, a solid 5 atars, with only one mentionable flaw. I've found only one other contenter for a 5 star rating, but for different trail conditions. I highly recomend these shoes and will be buying them myself as long as Salomon keeps making them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Weigel

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe but wears out fast
customer_reviews.text: I run hills and grass. This shoe is comfortable and lightweight. It fits nice. Issues: Wears out fast, it's expensive, and once the treads on bottom are worn out a bit, they do not grip at all! I've slipped and fallen wearing these shoes more than any other shoe I've owned. Summary: When they have full treads, they are great, when the treads wear down, which happen very quickly, they are not very useful.
customer_reviews.author: O. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: and perform very good for the conditions they are designed for
customer_reviews.text: Anything Salomon makes is top notch product. I say that I am a customer for a very long time on their products. They work, and perform very good for the conditions they are designed for. If you have done any research on this type of shoe, the toe is narrow on its design. Like everyone else has stated, order 1/2 size larger, and your good to go. I normally wear XA Pro 3 series of shoe in 9.5 size, ordered Speedcross 3's in size 10 and perfect fit. Tread on these shoes are excellent in sand, hard packed and loose. I do live in a desert environment and these are the ticket for all my trail runs.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Totes garbage, not recommended at all.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been less satisfied with a shoe purchase. The tread is too soft for anything but carpet. Do not ever wear these on the street. If you run on anything but grass, do not even come close to considering these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: J. to the S.

customer_reviews.title: Streamlining my worldly (shoe) possessions.
customer_reviews.text: Salomons run narrow, in my experience, and require a half-size larger. This is not a complaint, but is rather how I accommodate for the nature of this particular brand of shoe. The half-size increase does not issue in "clown shoes", but provides just the right amount of space to direct my toes forward - still on the snug side - but with room to spare for experimenting with different sock options. The shoe fits good, looks good, are light, and fulfill the need in any informal urban setting, in all my trail runnings, and in any light hiking/day-packing jaunt - thus eliminating the need for additional, more usage-specific, shoes.
customer_reviews.author: a brother in Christ

customer_reviews.title: Has helped me be a lot more active.
customer_reviews.text: albeit this is my first really good pair of shoes in 45 years; but these are super awesome. I have very narrow feet and have always had trouble getting shoes that fit well. These fit like a glove and I love they come in half sizes. They cup a little around the heel and fit comfortably snug. going up and down mountain inclines, I don't think twice - they grip well and my foot stays firm inside the shoe. So - I've been trying to get more active but my knees/etc were hurting. With these shoes, that is mostly gone so I want to go and do even more !
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Oatman

customer_reviews.title: Very Aggressive. Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes I wear them every day to work they're a little smaller than I expected I have owned several pairs of Solomon's and they put out a consistently quality product. I will need to replace the insoles since they're about half a size small hence the 4 star rating
customer_reviews.author: c s co

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I've had in years!
customer_reviews.text: I've liked Salomon shoes since I discovered them a few years ago, however, these new Speedcross 3's are by far the best. In addtion to their best-in-the industry lacing system, the fit is also really excellent, with great support, although I must stipulate that I also use Archmold supports in all my shoes. I've only worn them a few days, so far, but my initial impression is excellent. The shoes fit very well, are sytlish without going overboard, and are the best shoes I've owned for a long time in terms of comfort and support. I've also received a number of compliments and questions about them, can't remember the last time that happened! Nice job Salomon!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Mckasson

customer_reviews.title: When they arrived in the mail I put them on and was amazed at how comfortable they felt
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews on this shoe as well as a few others. I mainly wanted to see the opinions of those who wore it for Spartan races, as that is what I plan to use them for. When they arrived in the mail I put them on and was amazed at how comfortable they felt. A few days later I put them to the test on a 4 mile run across very rugged terrain. I live in Utah and finding rough terrain is not hard. They never slipped while the friends I ran with on regular shoes slipped several times on those steep sandy areas. I'll give more updates as I continue to use and abuse them.
customer_reviews.author: Zander

customer_reviews.title: VERY comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Although it's suited for hiking in soft/muddy trails, wearing it for everyday use is extremely comfortable. However, if you wear it everyday (on concrete or hard surfaces), it wears out FAST. But that's the trade-off... the rubber compound is formulated to be harder when on cold, muddy trails giving the excellent traction, but is soft and easy to wear out quickly. This is my second pair - the first pair I've purchased has been in use daily for 3 months now and the tread is about 2/3 worn down on areas with the most weight my feet steps on. Other than the wear issue, the comfort is the trade-off for me.
customer_reviews.author: INTEL

customer_reviews.title: Just Purchased My Third Pair!
customer_reviews.text: I am a heavyset guy that does moderate exercise and walks anywhere from 7500-30,000 steps/day. These shoes have a different look for everyday wear, but they are supportive, comfortable and sturdy. Each pair has lasted almost a year, and still had support and wear left, they just became 'discolored' from everyday wear! Salomon, keep making these, please!
customer_reviews.author: CMH1 Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: This shoe will best perform in rugged conditions with soft soil
customer_reviews.text: The sole of this shoe is similar to the tires of my mountain bike. This shoe is not designed to be used on concrete pavements of the inner city, mainly because the sole will manage to wear out very quickly. This shoe will best perform in rugged conditions with soft soil. Wear it in the deserts of Yemen. The Jungles of Congo. The mountain trails of Germany. But don't wear them in the streets of New York because you will stand out and look weird.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Dave

customer_reviews.title: Solid addition to my trail running quiver
customer_reviews.text: I use these for trail runs when it is a bit sloppy or snowy. The big lugs are about as good as it gets for traction. Longest run so far has been 15 hard miles and my feet felt fine. I usually where Hokas, so I was a bit surprised. I still use the Hokas on the longer stuff, but I plan on giving them a shot on a 25 miler next week. Definitely well made. I tend to like a little bit wider toe box and had shied away from these because they look narrow, but they fit perfectly. I need a good arch support and these have it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug B.

customer_reviews.title: The shoe's fit too tight on the sides of my feet.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes hoping to get a good comfortable shoe to walk in. After 6 months of using them here in there after the break-in period, they still have a tight squeeze on the sides of my feet. I would have liked to return them or exchange them for another pair. However, I can't seem to contact the seller or resolve it through Amazon options on my 'orders' page.
customer_reviews.author: Contra Mark

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: This shoes are perfect and one of the best I own. Originally it is for trail running but they are very comfortable and supporting also for every day use. I also tried to run with them on sidewalks but I did not gain too much experience with that so I can not comment about it. The design is also very nice and also the built and material, you need to order at least half a size higher then your normal size since they are a little bit narrow. I highly recommend about these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Eitan

customer_reviews.title: Amazingness
customer_reviews.text: I live in Miami and I work with dogs, I am always outside and needed some shoes that could stand all types of weather and wear and tear. My friend lives in California and is big into hiking so he recommended these shoes. They are by far the most comfortable and sturdy shoe I have ever worn, they have great traction and they are seriously lifeproof. I am usually a 10-10.5, I gambled and got these in a 10 and they fit a bit on the small side. These shoes are worth every penny, they are so amazing that two days later I bought another pair (10.5). Dont hesitate to hop on these bad boys.
customer_reviews.author: Barkhaus

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe with great quality but snug fit
customer_reviews.text: Normally I don't write these but I love these shoes. They remind me of the Salomon Cross country ski boots I owned many years ago. Comfortable, snug, they mold to your foot. The sole grips well and your foot will not slip on rough terrain and boulders. Note though that they fit snugly and so do not order too small. I wear 8.5 E lace shoes, 8E loafers, and 9.5 Mizuno running shoes. Ordered these in 9.5 and they fit but more snugly than the Mizunos. I will order another though in a cool color. Great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: SEALs Rule the High Seas

customer_reviews.title: best running trail shoe...
customer_reviews.text: this is the 4th pair of salomon speed cross i have owned. love the feel and look. i am normally a size 11.0 for nike and reebok. salomon i have noticed run a tad bigger probably could have gotten away with a 10.5, but i get to wear thicker ankle socks in return.. these are great on the trail, or dirt surface.. but be careful on any wet concrete or like surface, as these become very slick.. best running shoe i have ever had..Lightweight, hugs foot, hey....? they look cool too. non-neon colored nonsense that is popular now.
customer_reviews.author: daniel o

customer_reviews.title: A great multipurpose adventure shoe
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these for trail running and used them for such, however I have found that they make excelant flat pedal mountain bike cycling shoes! The rubber sole holds up well to the pins in my pedals. The lace system stays secure and does not get caught up on brush when one does a bit of bush whacking. They breat very well and I plan on purchasing another pair that match my bike. A great multipurpose adventure shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Yokum

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, great for running and hiking.  Initially I had a warrantly issue, but Salomon resolved it with flying colors!
customer_reviews.text: NIce shoes and I was happy at first, but they are falling apart after only a few months of light use. The sole at the heal is starting to peal back. Shouldn't happen on a pair of $100 shoes. So not happy with the pair I received and trying to figure out how to get them exchanged. Update. Solomon stood behind their products and are giving me a $130 voucher for a new pair and I get to keep the damaged pair and get them repaired, so I will definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Lance W.

customer_reviews.title: Great until a few months usage
customer_reviews.text: I love this companys shoes and but then exclusively for hiking and workout. But this midel shoes, the inside heel wore out, causing rubbing and injuries to my foot after about six months of moderate use. Not what I expect from the cost and this company
customer_reviews.author: Bailey in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: depends on where they are shipped from
customer_reviews.text: This my 2nd pair I have one in all black they came from amazon love them. this blue pair was shipped from china. They dont seem to be as good of quality. the pocket on the tongue was torn when I got them also they seem a bit smaller even though they are the same size and the tongue is much more flimsy with softer padding in it. the whole shoe feels like its not as well made so I wouldn't buy them again if they were shipping from china
customer_reviews.author: CAB

customer_reviews.title: If these had better soles they'd be a killer shoe...
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes but I wish the soles lasted more. After a few months of use, the threads were practically gone. They're still ok to use but not like when they were brand new. I love the way the camo looks. I used these to hike in Machu Picchu and with the slick rocks from the rain, the traction these provided was amazing. However, now that the threads are gone, the traction has decreased significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly Narrow Fit!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 10.5 USA / 44.5 EURO, which is my usual size for a "medium" width running shoe. Right from looking at the sneakers in the box, they looked very narrow. I checked and checked to see if the sneakers were the wrong width from my order. They have no width description whatsoever. The quality of the constructions looks very good, albeit these are brand new. I would assume they will work well for cross country runners with narrow feet. They will not work for normal width and should not even be considered for anyone with feet requiring any extra width.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fits perfect. Snug fit almost does require lacing. Then again the No Tie lacing system works really well. I need a wider fit and Solomon is the only shoe I can depend on fitting without crushing my toes. The tread grabs everything in any direction, up or down hill. You can wear them on the street but it would probably wear down the tread lugs faster.
customer_reviews.author: brentmarla

customer_reviews.title: ... a competitive shooter and needed a rugged shoe with good traction. I was very impressed with the performance ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a competitive shooter and needed a rugged shoe with good traction. I was very impressed with the performance of the shoe on the loose dirt here in Arizona. I could move quickly and effectively across the combat courses. The only problem I had was that the cleats are quite hard and when I was forced onto a hard surface like wood or cement they were quite slippery. It was a little surprise the first time but even though not perfect these shoes rock!
customer_reviews.author: Mark P Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Shoe for Trail Running
customer_reviews.text: I dang love this shoe. Super comfortable right out of the box. I've been running it for weeks and never had any foot discomfort. I'm running 4-5 mile runs, which is huge for me but may be a lot less than many of you run, so keep that in mind. Gearing up for a 10K mud run this weekend, super excited.
customer_reviews.author: DMcnl

customer_reviews.title: They keep up with you
customer_reviews.text: Slight ankle stability but nothing to brag home about. Lightweight for what's given, durable, dries quickly, good traction even when wet and muddy. I've used these shoes from trail running to hiking in The Narrows in Zion. I never experienced a single issue and they've kept up with me.
customer_reviews.author: Ampeed

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Really great shoe as long as you get the real salomon because there are a lot of fakes that you can tell are not the real thing. But the salomon speedcross is a great shoe I had back surgery a year ago and this is the only shoe I can wear all day and not have my feet and back killing me by the time I get home from work. I own 3 pair as of now but will be buying more since they have enough colors I can wear a different one every day of the week.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Salomon Speedcross 3 Shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is more comfortable than expected, given it looks like a cross trainer. Good support. lacing system is unique...time will tell if the cinch will continue to keep laces tight. Fits closer to a 13 than a 14...not a good choice if you have a wider or wider foot. Quality of stitching, gluing, all very good. A nice addition to my shoe collection.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher F.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love these shoes so bad!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look of this shoe for so long. Finally bought a pair, but sadly, had to return them. It's a great, well made shoe and does what it is made to do very well, running on dirt and trails. Unlike other trail shoes I've owned, the very deep treads made them uncomfortable to wear on hard surfaces. It's like off-road tires on a truck. They're great in the mud but suck on the road. If you're considering these for everyday wear or running on hard surfaces, there are better choices out there.
customer_reviews.author: PTRK

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: I bought another pair. That is how much I like these shoes.. I wore them through the first sole layer. They are not light, but they are warm and they make rough terrain manageable. I would have got the Speedcross 4 but the price point is a little high. And the price of these dropped since the 4 arrived.. Try them they are ideal for outdoors!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.LindenWillow

customer_reviews.title: I ultimately opted for the Saucony Peregrine 7 shoes and I am really happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps it doesn't seem right to rate these shoes since I ultimately returned them, but for me, they were too narrow and tight. I actually bought both a 10 and a 9.5 (I usually wear a 9.5) and they were both really narrow on the front of my foot. I bought them for OCR races, but I think that the advantage of having extra traction would be negated by the soreness I'd feel halfway through a race. I ultimately opted for the Saucony Peregrine 7 shoes and I am really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DMag

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING GLOVE FITTING LIGHT WIEGHT SHOE
customer_reviews.text: these shoes are fantastic they are narrower then I expected which makes me very happy most shoes do not fit me in the width area but these are superb. LOVE LOVE these shoes. I will be purchasing another pair for sure this has become my new favorite shoe. AWESOME shoe! This shoe hugs my foot like an additional layer of skin. Perfect fit and light weight. I don't normally praise a product but these shoes are nothing short of amazing. And they have superb traction.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt

customer_reviews.title: A great shoe for OCRs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes as they came highly recommended by people that take part in Spartan Races. I found that the toe box is a little narrower than I prefer. Having said that, these shoes held up very well in a Spartan Race I recently competed in. It provided excellent grip on the various surfaces I encountered (mud, sand, dirt), and water/mud drained out adequately with each step I took. The cushioning was phenomenal...after a 8-10 mile course, my feet were not sore at all. I would say if you are considering buying these shoes, definitely find a local store that sells them first to see if you enjoy the fit. If you do, then this shoe will not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: SFSpartan10

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: every avid trail-runner should own a pair of speedcross III. The insoles that come with the shoes are decent but I always suggest adding your own. I've always worn these shoes for trail runs but last weekend I wore them to compete in the Tri State Spartan Beast. One of the toughest courses I've ever faced and the shoes performed perfectly. The laces are awesome Excellent grip on a slippery, muddy, rocky mountain. The drainage to keep your feet dry is great. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE SHOES
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for trail running and to compete in a mud run. Rating: Love them - most comfortable trail shoe I have worn. Pros: Great feel, excellent traction and light weight. Made short work of muddy inclines that regular running/training shoes were struggling to get up. Cons: The speed laces aren't my favorite. I have used better designs before that are easier to take off.
customer_reviews.author: G. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Here you go....
customer_reviews.text: Like many have stated these need a break-in period and a little tweaking. I have always steered away from Salomon because they felt tight in the store and these were tight out the box, so I wore them around the house for a few days for 15 min or so. The lacing system makes the fit able to be zeroed in. They feel great now and I have started to wear them daily...great. I have a medium / narrow foot and I don't know if these would work for a wide foot. Purchased a size 12 which is what I normally wear in a running / training shoe. Got a 25% off deal, price was 72.00....sweet!
customer_reviews.author: DMTunes

customer_reviews.title: Just tight and not great for a long day on the trail or a ...
customer_reviews.text: Just tight and not great for a long day on the trail or a long day on the plane or a long day on the street ... I went for the Keen as a replacement and that fit perfectly, just not the quality and sleek design, but comfort and usability far outstrips this footwear. This footwear looks great, but you better have slim slim narrow and shorter feet than you think you need. I would pass if you can't try them and like them for awhile. They look cool sitting at the bottom of my closet.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoes for hiking, but not for me:(
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for hiking! Keep my ankles safe from twisting! Had 19miles hike in one day and didn't even get a blister! Love them! Updating my review: Unfortunately, I got issues wearing those shoes after the second hike. I've got very sharp pain in my Achilles tendon. The rest of my shoes never caused me such a problem. I believe it's more likely anatomical problem.. It's a great shoes still, but just sad that I can not wear them for hiking any more:( it hurts right on I wear them.
customer_reviews.author: alex budin

customer_reviews.title: I originally purchased the Reebox All Terrain Super 2. 0 SPT for my upcoming Spartan Sprint
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the Reebox All Terrain Super 2.0 SPT for my upcoming Spartan Sprint. When I wear polypro type socks my feet slid all over the place and did not seem to have any real support. Got my Salomons yesterday and 1 mile into my trail run was absolutely loving these shoes. They are thicker than the Reebox so I feel like I have more foot protection and very little slip. The speed laces should be on every trail and OCR shoe made!! Will follow up after I get a good race in them.
customer_reviews.author: bmarlin

customer_reviews.title: barbed wire shoe strings
customer_reviews.text: Would of given it 5 stars if it weren't for the awful shoe strings. Not everyone wants these and the traditional strings work so much better just good luck in trying to switch them out. They need to offer the regular shoe strings if you want them. I like my strings really tight and its hard to get these like that and hurt your hands the tighter you pull them. Also I wear an 11 an bought a 12 and they are still very snug. Otherwise they are awesome comfort for the price!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great traction on these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great traction on these shoes. Good for trail hiking or running. I like the speed lacing, though the lace ends up being a little long; you just have to tuck it under the laces or through the loop on the tongue. These shoes have a moderate amount of cushion and I don't really feel sharp rocks coming up through the soles. The last has a good balance between flexibility and stiffness to give the right amount of support and protection from the trail.
customer_reviews.author: CEO

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic pair of trail running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are fantastic. I run trails and have found them to be ultra comfortable. The first time I wore them, I refereed 3 full length soccer games back to back with no issues. The traction is great on the pitch as well as on the trails, I could not be happier with them. I immediately ordered a second pair for the mud runs and trails as I want to keep the black pair for the soccer field. Great support for my arches too, as I'm a high arch, plantars fasciitis sufferer. Can't beat them!
customer_reviews.author: MojoFitFifty

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best shoes I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best athletic shoes I've ever owned. I can wear these all day on concrete or dirt/rock. I will definitely purchase another pair sooner than later. I really like the easy no laces system, and support for my foot is great! I wore these to the Grand Canyon and had no problem with grip on the dirt and rock. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart T.

customer_reviews.title: Speedcross 3 Trail shoes are amazing and comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I tried the 3D XA shoes first and love those too. i could def wear these Speedcross 3 shoes all day every day if it were not for this work thing that does not allow sneakers everyday... This is my second pair of Salomon's in 30 days and I am planning to buy a third pair soon to replace the 4 pair of shoes i am tossing because i love these so much more. i love them so much that i bought a pair for my wife for Christmas butt shhhhhh.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Arr

customer_reviews.title: Very light
customer_reviews.text: The grips do not last long. I opted for the Ultra X model which is a compromise. Much more durable grips for a little more weight, but still great fit / feel.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. LaBrie

customer_reviews.title: the very best Obstacle Racing Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Used at Tough Mudder Pittsburgh... Used North Face trail shoes prior... I thought those had traction!!! Almost unreal traction up wet slick clay. Dry after 1/4mile. GoreTex is useless in low trail shoes anyway. Paired with trail running socks found here on Amazon and felt like I could run several laps of the course! Only complaint is speed lace buckle packs with mud amd jammed. With sore calves it was frustrating not being able to loosen them up to remove!
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the most comfortable pair of shoes I've ever owned. They have great support, soft heel cushioning, and a very aggressive tread. It is one of the few pairs of running shoes that I have received several compliments on how they look. Has a great lace system making getting on and off very fast. The tread is great for mud and snow type conditions. I like these so well I bought another pair in another color. They hug your foot just enough to make it feel like they were custom made for your feet. Very durable and is great in wet environments. My favorite running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco680

customer_reviews.title: Still nicely designed and very comfortable though
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a huge fan of Salomon shoes with this type of lacing system. Now that I've had several pairs, I've probably saved 3 or 4 days of my life spent doing nothing but tying shoes. ;-) The quality of this shoe is just as high as the others I have purchased. However, knowing that Salomon shoes tend to run a tad narrow, I have noted that these are even more narrow than previous pairs I have owned. Still nicely designed and very comfortable though.

product_meta.title: Salomon Men's Speedcross 3 Trail Running Shoe
product_meta.description:
When your off-road trek takes you even further off the beaten path, Salomon's Speedcross 3 is there to carry you through. Lightweight construction meets the aggressive tread of the Mud and Snow Contagrip sole for a premium blend of performance and fit. The Quicklace system gets you suited up lickity split so you hit the ground running and never look back.

Salomon was born in 1947 in the heart of the French Alps and the birthplace of modern alpinism. Driven by a passion for skiing and design innovation, Francois Salomon and his son George designed and perfected much of the first modern ski equipment. During the following 60 years, Salomon's commitment to innovative design and passion for mountain sports created a vast range of revolutionary new concepts in boots, skis and apparel and brought innovative solutions to footwear, apparel and equipment for hiking, adventure racing, mountaineering and trail running. Through performance-driven design, Salomon enhances mountain sports by converting new ideas into action and expanding the limits of possibility.
